info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued May 08 at 2:04PM MDT until May 08 at 10:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...LONG DURATION RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FOR THE NORTHEAST HIGHLANDS AS WELL AS THE SANDIA, MANZANO, AND GALLINAS MOUNTAINS THROUGH 9 PM MDT MONDAY DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS, SEVERAL HOURS OF SINGLE DIGIT HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AS WELL AS AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ALL OTHER AREAS FROM UNTIL 10 PM MDT TODAY AND AGAIN FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM ON MONDAY DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE AVERAGE WARMTH AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FOR THE CENTRAL MOUNTAIN CHAIN EASTWARD INTO THE PLAINS OF NEW MEXICO DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, ABOVE NORMAL TEMPERATURES AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .A dire and critical to extreme fire weather event is underway. This long duration of strong, gusty and potentially damaging winds will continue into Monday along with exceptionally low afternoon humidity and poor overnight humidity recoveries. Above normal temperatures will also persist into the middle of the week along with high Haines indices that will yield very unstable conditions leading to rapid and potentially catastrophic fire spread and growth. While winds are expected to decrease in speed some Monday evening, gusty winds will redevelop over much of the eastern half of New Mexico on Tuesday, leading to another round of critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM MDT THIS EVENING... ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO 9 PM MDT MONDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH TUESDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...Northeast and East Central Plains until 10 PM MDT today, redeveloping again Monday morning through Monday evening and also late Tuesday morning through early Tuesday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest winds of 25 to 40 mph with occasional gusts of 50 to near 60 mph today and Monday. South southwest winds on Tuesday at 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts of 35 to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Ranging from 4 to 8 percent each day with long durations of single digit relative humidities as well as poor overnight recoveries. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will spread rapidly and will be very hard to control. Long range spotting and extreme fire behavior will be possible. Outdoor burning should not be done.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of these extremely dangerous Red Flag Warnings. Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.
